clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of ( I-PRF) With Bone Graft and (L-PRF) Membrane in The Treatment of Gingival Recession
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Injectable Platelet Rich Fibrin ( I-PRF) With Bone Graft and Leukocyte Platelet Rich Fibrin(L-PRF) Membrane in The Treatment of Localized Gingival Recession (Randomized Controlled Clinical and Tomographic Study)

brief_summary.textblock: evaluation of the use of i PRF and bone graft in conjunction with coronally repositioned flap and the use of L-PRF membrane with coronally repositioned flap in treatment of localized gingival recession (Class I & II) in comparison with the use of connective tissue graft

detailed_description.textblock:
Thirty patients, who are candidates for gingival recession coverage, will participate in this prospective clinical trial.Group 1(10 patients) :
Coronally repositioned flap will be done and bone graft mixed with I PRF will be applied into the tissues
Group 2(10 patients) :
Coronally repositioned flap will be done and L PRF membrane will be placed into the tissues
Group 3 (Control group)(10 patients) :
Coronally repositioned flap will be done with sub epithelial connective tissue Parameters
- Clinical evaluation of Length and width of Attached gingiva
- Esthetic outcome evaluation Will be done using the root coverage esthetic score (Cairo et al. 2009) that include
Both evaluations will be done at 3, 6 and 9 months

primary_outcome.description: 2-Esthetic outcome evaluation was done using Root coverage esthetic score (RES) system ( Cairo et al. 2009) the RES include the following parameters â€¢ Level of the gingival margin (GM):(minimum) Zero points = failure of root coverage (gingival margin apical or equal to the baseline recession); 3 points = partial root coverage;(maximum) 6 points = CRC.

secondary_outcome.description: Preoperatively a cast was made and scanned. At 9 months after surgical procedure the same procedure was done to determine the soft tissue thickness after the surgery. The difference between the tissue thickness before and after was used to determine the efficacy of the different surgical grafting materials used.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Injectable Platelet Rich Fibrin with bone graft
arm_group.description: Injectable Platelet Rich Fibrin will be used
Leukocyte Platelet Rich Fibrin will be used

intervention.intervention_name: Injectable Platelet rich fibrin,Leukocyte Platelet rich fibrin
intervention.description: the use of Leukocyte Platelet rich fibrin , Injectable Platelet Rich Fibrin as grafting materials for treatment of recession
intervention.arm_group_label: Injectable Platelet Rich Fibrin with bone graft

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Systemically free patients (American Society of Anesthesiologists I; ASA I).
- Age range (20 -40) years.
- Good compliance with the plaque control instructions following initial therapy.
- Patients diagnosed with Miller class I or II in anterior and premolar teeth
- Availability for follow up and maintenance program.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient suffering from periodontitis
- Presence of smoking habit.
- Presence of occlusion interference.
- Pregnant and lactating females.
- Vulnerable group of patients (handicapped, mentally retarded and prisoners).
